member.name: T:Native.BaseLogBehaviour
member.summary: Handles logging for the game by using a list of instances. Provides methods to log messages with different verbosity levels, including levels.

member.name: P:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.LogWriters
member.summary: Gets or sets the list of instances used to handle log output. If not set, a default is used.

member.name: P:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.EnabledLogVerbosity
member.summary: Gets the verbosity level for logging. Only logs with a verbosity level equal to or higher than this value will be processed.

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.Init(Common.IServiceCollection{Debugger.ILogWriter})
member.summary: Initializes the log writers using the provided logging service collection.
member.param: An instance of from which to initialize log writers.
member.exception: Thrown when is not an instance of .

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.Log(Debugger.LogVerbosity,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a message with the specified level.
member.param: The verbosity level of the log.
The message to log.
Arguments to format the log message.

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.LogInfo(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an informational message.
member.param: The message to log.
Arguments to format the log message.

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.LogWarning(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs a warning message.
member.param: The message to log.
Arguments to format the log message.

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.LogError(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Logs an error message.
member.param: The message to log.
Arguments to format the log message.

member.name: M:Native.BaseLogBehaviour.ThrowException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Logs an exception and then throws it.
member.param: The exception to log and throw.

member.name: T:Native.IVirtualKeyboard
member.summary: Represents an interface for a virtual keyboard used in Unity applications.
member.remarks: This interface is intended for use with Unity's touch keyboard functionality. For more information on Unity's touch keyboard, refer to the Unity Touch Keyboard Documentation.

member.name: M:Native.IVirtualKeyboard.Show(System.String,UnityEngine.TouchScreenKeyboardType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays the virtual keyboard to the user with various customization options.
member.param: The prompt text to display to the user. If null, no prompt will be shown.
The type of keyboard to display. Defaults to . For more options, refer to the TouchScreenKeyboardType Documentation.
Whether to enable auto-correction. Defaults to false.
Whether to allow multiple lines of input. Defaults to false.
Whether to use secure input mode (e.g., for password input). Defaults to false.
Whether to enable an alert message. Defaults to false.
The initial text to display in the input field. If null, no initial text will be shown.
The maximum length of the input text. Defaults to 100.
member.remarks: For additional details on using these parameters with Unity's touch keyboard, refer to the Unity Touch Keyboard Documentation.

member.name: T:Native.Singleton`1
member.summary:
A generic singleton base class for MonoBehaviour types.
Provides a singleton instance of the derived class.
For more information on singletons, see Singleton Pattern on Wikipedia.
member.typeparam: The type of the singleton instance, which must be a MonoBehaviour.

member.name: P:Native.Singleton`1.Instance
member.summary:
Gets the singleton instance of the specified type.
Finds the singleton instance if it does not already exist.
For more information on finding objects of a type, see FindObjectOfType in Unity Documentation.

member.name: P:Native.Singleton`1.DoNotDestroyOnLoad
member.summary:
Indicates whether the singleton instance should not be destroyed on scene load.
If set to true, the instance will persist between scenes.
For more information on this behavior, see DontDestroyOnLoad in Unity Documentation.

member.name: M:Native.Singleton`1.Init(Common.IServiceCollection{Debugger.ILogWriter})
member.summary:
Initializes the singleton instance and handles persistence across scene loads if is true.
Also ensures that only one instance of the singleton exists in the scene. If another instance is found, it will be destroyed.
member.param: An instance of used for logging.

member.name: T:Native.UI.OnScreenKeyboard
member.summary: Implements the interface to provide an on-screen keyboard functionality.
member.remarks: This class is a custom implementation for providing on-screen keyboard functionalities, which may involve interactions with Unity's or other input methods. For details on how to handle on-screen keyboards in Unity, refer to the Unity Touch Keyboard Documentation.

member.name: M:Native.UI.OnScreenKeyboard.Show(System.String,UnityEngine.TouchScreenKeyboardType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays the virtual keyboard with various customization options.
member.param: The prompt text to display to the user. If null, no prompt will be shown.
The type of keyboard to display. Defaults to . For more options, refer to the TouchScreenKeyboardType Documentation.
Whether to enable auto-correction. Defaults to false.
Whether to allow multiple lines of input. Defaults to false.
Whether to use secure input mode (e.g., for password input). Defaults to false.
Whether to enable an alert message. Defaults to false.
The initial text to display in the input field. If null, no initial text will be shown.
The maximum length of the input text. Defaults to 300.
member.remarks: If the virtual keyboard is already showing, this method will not create a new instance.

member.name: T:Native.UI.TouchScreenKeyboard
member.summary: Implements the interface to provide a virtual keyboard using Unity's TouchScreenKeyboard.
member.remarks: This class wraps Unity's to provide an interface for displaying a virtual keyboard. For more information on Unity's TouchScreenKeyboard, refer to the Unity Touch Keyboard Documentation.

member.name: M:Native.UI.TouchScreenKeyboard.Show(System.String,UnityEngine.TouchScreenKeyboardType,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays the virtual keyboard with various customization options.
member.param: The prompt text to display to the user. If null, no prompt will be shown.
The type of keyboard to display. Defaults to . For more options, refer to the TouchScreenKeyboardType Documentation.
Whether to enable auto-correction. Defaults to false.
Whether to allow multiple lines of input. Defaults to false.
Whether to use secure input mode (e.g., for password input). Defaults to false.
Whether to enable an alert message. Defaults to false.
The initial text to display in the input field. If null, no initial text will be shown.
The maximum length of the input text. Defaults to 300.
member.remarks: If the virtual keyboard is already showing, this method will not create a new instance.

member.name: M:Native.UI.TouchScreenKeyboard.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the virtual keyboard resources.
member.remarks: The current implementation throws . You should provide a proper implementation to handle the disposal of resources and cleanup.

member.name: M:Native.UI.TouchScreenKeyboard.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizer for the class.
member.remarks: This finalizer is not currently implemented. Consider implementing proper cleanup if needed.
